longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Syria are allowed to enter with an expired
  passport, if continuing to Syria within 24 hours. 
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry issued to
  nationals of Syria must be valid for a minimum of 6 months
  from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a  Laissez-Passer  issued by Syria, to nationals
  of Syria.

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, passing through
Lebanon on their way to Syria can obtain a visa on arrival at
Beirut (BEY) for max. stay of 48 hours.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, traveling as
tourists can obtain a visa on arrival at Beirut (BEY) for the
duration of the pre-arranged hotel accomodation if:
 
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, traveling for
business can obtain a visa on arrival at Beirut (BEY) for max.
stay of 1 month provided:  
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, owning property
in Lebanon  can obtain a visa on arrival at Beirut (BEY) for
max. stay of 6 months provided:  
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, traveling to
Lebanon for medical treatment can obtain a visa on arrival at
Beirut (BEY) for max. stay of 72 hours, provided holding
medical reports/certificates of treatment/condition. Extension
possible.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, visiting a
foreign embassy in Lebanon can obtain a visa on arrival at
Beirut (BEY) for max. stay of 48 hours, provided holding proof
of scheduled appointment. 
Visa required, except for Nationals of Syria, traveling to
study in an accredited school or university can obtain a visa
on arrival at Beirut (BEY) for max. stay of 7 days, provided:
 
Visa required, except for Spouses and children of Lebanese
nationals can obtain a visa on arrival at Beirut (BEY) for
max. stay of 6 months provided holding official marriage
certificate, family book or other valid proof of relationship.

Minors:
- Minors under 18 years of age can enter with passports valid
  for the period of intended stay, when accompanied by a
  parent.
- Children under 15 years of age, 
- Children under 15 years of age, 
Additional Information:
- Females, having previously undertaken employment as artists
  or masseuses in Lebanon 
Warning:
- Holders of passports containing any Israeli visa or stamp
  will be refused entry.
- Maids must ensure that their passport includes a departure
  stamp issued by the country they departed from
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here or Cape Verde. 

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Warning:
- Passengers arriving from Afghanistan, Cameroon, Equatorial
  Guinea, Ethiopia, Iraq, Nigeria, Somalia or Syria must hold
  a certificate of polio vaccination, administered at least 4
  weeks and at most 1 year prior to arrival.
